intro: Osteospermum caulescens, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white to pale blue petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features a hairy stem with alternate leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping. Osteospermum caulescens is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
